title: The Death Recap [RE-DESIGNED]
body:
For those who have seen many of my posts, you'll know a vast majority of them are to do with Death Recap mistakes.

Im not sure how many people actually use the Death recap, but I do, and it gives valuable information that can help you in the next fight _(if it ever actually worked properly that is)_

Word on the street a long time ago was that Riot was working on an updated version, but it has since been a couple of years, and I have somewhat lost confidence in that. 

So rather than just complaining again, I figured I'd do my part and actually help put forward a design suggestion to Riot, just incase anything helped.

Here it is:

http://imgur.com/a/NnMdC

and closed up:

http://imgur.com/a/dx9AP

I have taken a different approach to the live recap.
It is slightly more complicated, but displays vastly more information.

Rather than confining the recap to a single page _(which is easy to use, but inaccurate)_, I have divided it up so you can select different champions to view their damage output, _(which requires slightly more effort, but is much clearer)_.

**It is important that the Death Recap be useful to both people who only glance at it briefly to get the gist, and those who want to study it a little closer.**

Having it too complicated will put many players off, and having it too simple makes it useless for the people who use it to adapt their builds and playstyle.

I have divided the death recap up into 3 sections, and I shall break down my design decisions accordingly:

________

**Section 1:**

_________

Section 1 is the top segment showing the champion portraits.
Section 1 is mainly for those who just glance briefly at the death recap. It is larger than the others, to make viewing quick and easy.
At a brief glance, it shows you 4 things:

1. What champions dealt damage to you. _(champions not involved in your death are greyed out,)_

2. Your killer. _(The champion that dealt the final blow is centred and is larger than the rest, in this case, Kassadin.)_

3. How much % of the damage taken, came from each champion. (Kassadin dealt 73% of the damage, while Soraka only did 27%)

4. The main type of damage from each champion. _(both Kassadin and Soraka dealt primarily magic damage, as indicated by purple text. A physical damage champion would have a red number, and Vayne might possibly have a white one in some situations.)_

Unlike the live death recap, it shows every champion that damaged you, not just the top 3. Increasing clarity after team fights.
For many people, thats all they want to know, and they need look at it no further.
But for those wanting to know more, you can select different champions in section 1 in order to change section 2.

__________

**Section 2:**

__________

Section 2 shows the breakdown of all the damage sources of a single champion that affected your death.
We can learn 3 things:

1. Exactly what damage sources (or cc) you were hit with, per champion.

2. Which sources did the most damage.

3. What type of damage each source did.

In this case we can see that Kassadin used his QWER, proc'd thunderlords, used ignite, and auto attacked us with red buff, activating sheen. We can see that most of his power comes from magic damage, but there was still roughly 250 non-magic damage.
If you clicked on Soraka, the golden border would switch to her, and Kassadin's damage sources would be replaced with hers.

This horizontal way of showing it, as well as showing only 1 champ at a time, means that you can go to a far greater level of detail than just the top 3 spells it is currently,_(or sometimes the bottom 3, depending on the death recap's glitchy mood)_

The damage sources are listed from highest to lowest damage, for ease of reading. _(so if you want, you can just glance at the first few, to see the majority of where the damage came from)_

___________

**Section 3:**

___________

Section 3 gives you the damage that comes from non-champion sources, such as: 
Minions, towers, jungle monsters, and epic monsters.

Each source has its own symbol, that symbol becomes lighter when that entity assisted in your death, but is otherwise greyed out, and the damage dealt by each entity is shown below. _(in this situation we can see that we took minion and tower aggro, but no damage from baron/dragon/herald/jungle-creeps)_ This means that minion aggro doesn't take up an 'assist' slot, like in the live recap, and will be registered even if you have more than 3 champs attacking you.

Section 3 also shows a new piece of information: **What actually killed you!**
This is something that is missing from the live death recap. 
We have all come out of a fight by the skin of our teeth, just to die randomly outside the fight, and have no idea what caused our death.
With this design, it doesn't matter how much or little damage it did, the recap will show you what effect brought you from 1 HP to 0 HP _(wether it was Death-fire-touch, or Demacian Justice)_, in the form of a large icon in the middle of the page. _(In this case, we can see that Kassadin's ignite did the final damage.)_ But if minion aggro killed us, it would show an icon of a minion instead.

Also at the bottom of the recap, it gives us the same "X damage within X time" statistic which is always useful.

___________

When the recap is closed, it is dulled in colour _(so you don't have a giant shiny golden bar in front of your face while trying to watch a fight)_, but still shows you the damage taken, and the time it took, for ease of reference.

I have done away with some information that is on the live recap.

1. The summoner name is gone. This doesn't really help tell you how you died _(and no one really cares)_, and you can always check in in the TAB menu anyway, so I figured it just took up space and wasn't essential to the recap.

2. The champion's items are gone, again, you can check this in TAB, and doesn't directly tell you how you died, so I thought it unnecessary as well.

3. Words. _(Damage, Riftwalk, KIller, magic, physical, ignite)_ are all words that are in the live recap, but are kind of unessecary. Once you know the logic _(purple is magic, red is physical)_, you don't really need words, and they just become clutter. Most league players instantly know the visuals anyway.
_(it is a possibility that words could pop up when you hover over the icon, if people still want words?)_

I cant really be the judge of wether this is better or worse than the current one _(because I'm bias towards my own work)_.
But I personally would be satisfied with this level of information in the death recap.

____________

I want to stress that, a random player, did this design in a day.. a few hours even. _(it's far from perfect, but i think it's more helpful than the current system.)_ So Imagine what an entire team of professionals in a multi billion dollar company could do over a couple of months!

So yea, I thought id put it out there. Let me know if you like it, or if you don't.
Hopefully someone at Riot can pass it on to whoever might be looking at the death recap, maybe it'll provide an Idea, maybe not. 

______

**TL;DR:** I designed a new Death recap in the hope something in it might help Riot with developing a new one:
http://imgur.com/a/NnMdC

replies.body: Wow! This looks helpful, which means it won't ever be implemented.
Wow, you made that entirely yourself? Impressive, if you didn't tell us otherwise I would of thought Riot had actually made it themselves, well done.

Well I screenshotted and used the symbols and borders that riot made for other things, to make sure the design was consistent with their 'hextech' look. 

but I put it all together and made the 'system' haha 
hopefully it helps someone, somewhere. xD
